intro: Amsinckia franciscana, commonly known as the San Francisco fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to coastal climates with mild winters and warm, dry summers. Amsinckia franciscana is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its historical use by indigenous communities.
